intro: Notopleura panamensis, commonly known as the Panama notopleura, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth, glossy surface. Notopleura panamensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as tropical forests and along stream banks.
